programme.title: 2025 Stanley Cup Playoffs
programme.desc: Dallas evened the series at one game apiece with a 4-3 overtime win over Colorado in Game 2 behind a game-tying goal from Evgenii Dadonov in the third before a game-winner from Colin Blackwell in the extra period; Jake Oettinger stopped 34 shots.

programme.desc: Winnipeg jumped out to a 2-0 series lead with a 2-1 win over St. Louis in Game 2 behind goals from Mark Scheifele and Kyle Connor, along with 21 saves from Connor Hellebuyck; Jimmy Snuggerud scored the lone goal for the Blues in the loss.

programme.title: College Baseball
programme.desc: Coverage of college baseball games.

programme.title: College Softball
programme.desc: No. 19-ranked Mississippi State (25-5) is 3-1 on the road this season after defeating UAB, 8-4, on March 19; Northwestern (13-9) enters the series against the Bulldogs on a seven-game winning streak; inaugural meeting between the programs.

programme.title: Gr8tness
programme.desc: A record once thought to be untouchable, Alex Ovechkin gives an all-access look as he chases the 894 goals of the legendary Wayne Gretzky, showing how he prepares for his games and the pressure he is facing to break the prestigious record.

programme.title: Goliath Fishing
programme.desc: James Marko travels across South Florida on fishing expeditions in hopes of reeling in trophy-caliber fish at each one of his stops, discussing the techniques he implements to find success out on the water and the equipment he uses to reel them in.

programme.title: ESPN Films
programme.desc: The most remarkable sports stories are featured, as storytellers break away from the traditional view of a sports film and showcasing stories of passion, triumph, loss and resurgence of athletes, as featured guests share their side of the story.

programme.title: Jimmy Houston OutDoors
programme.desc: Jimmy Houston is joined by Tim Duke on a fishing expedition in hopes of finding trophy-caliber golden dorado, discussing the equipment they are using out on the water and the techniques they are implementing to find success with the fish.

programme.title: College Softball
programme.desc: No. 19-ranked Mississippi State (25-5) is 3-1 on the road this season after defeating UAB, 8-4, on March 19; Northwestern (13-9) enters the series against the Bulldogs on a seven-game winning streak; inaugural meeting between the programs.

programme.title: Copa America 2024: Argentina's Road to Glory
CONCACAF Champions League Soccer
programme.desc: Tigres claimed a 2-1 victory against Cruz Azul in their most recent meeting on Feb. 15 through goals from Diego Lainez and Joaquim in the 48th and 54th minutes; Rômulo Zwarg and Ozziel Herrera provided the assists in the win at home.

programme.title: The American Rodeo
programme.desc: Cowboys, ranging in age from 11 to 53 and representing 31 states and fourth countries, compete in saddle bronc, steer wrestling, tie-down roping, bull riding, breakaway, bareback riding, barrel racing and team roping.

programme.title: CONCACAF Champions League Soccer
programme.desc: Tigres claimed a 2-1 victory against Cruz Azul in their most recent meeting on Feb. 15 through goals from Diego Lainez and Joaquim in the 48th and 54th minutes; Rômulo Zwarg and Ozziel Herrera provided the assists in the win at home.

programme.title: Speak
programme.desc: The daily sports talk show delivers a compelling, incisive and passionate filter to the top sports stories of the day as the host engages in lively discussions, debates and disagreements over the day's news, and no topic is off limits.

programme.title: The Herd with Colin Cowherd
programme.desc: Breaking down the biggest sports news of the day along with various unique segments that help the host present his opinions on sports; players, coaches and celebrities are interviewed and discuss trending topics happening around the world.

programme.desc: Craig Carton, a newly inducted member of the New York State Broadcasters Hall of Fame, joins Chicago sports radio personality Danny Parkins and FOX NFL game analyst Mark Schlereth to discuss the most enticing stories in sports each weekday morning.

programme.title: UFL Football
programme.desc: Defending champion Birmingham (2-1) won two straight since falling to DC, 18-11, beating Arlington, 10-9, on April 11 behind Matt Corral; Houston (1-2) ended its two-game skid with an 18-17 win over Memphis behind Nolan Henderson.

programme.title: The Facility
programme.desc: Former football players break down the latest sports news making headlines across the country, giving a unique perspective from the athletes point of view on results of some of the recent marquee matchups and the stories impacting their league.

programme.title: Destined to Drive: Patrick Dempsey's Return to Racing
Indycar NICS Racing
programme.desc: Two-time defending champion Alex Palou increased its lead over Pato O'Ward to 39 points after winning at Thermal Club for a second-straight victory; Scott Dixon averaged 98.35 mph en route to his win at Long Beach last year over Colton Herta.

programme.title: The American Rodeo
programme.desc: Over $3 million in prize money is awarded, including a $1 million bonus for the winner of the championship round, as 15 athletes compete in each of the eight rodeo disciplines compete against the top 5 ranked athletes in their events.

programme.desc: Covering gossip, scandal and the everyday lives of athletes in college and professional sports, the crew comically highlights exclusive footage of the superstars spotted around Hollywood, New York City and other parts of the country.

programme.title: Bassmaster Elite Series
programme.desc: Two weeks prior to event, good water clarity and lake level less than half a foot over the full pool level of 660 feet was reported, with midmorning water temperatures reading around 65 degrees, all of which point to a spawn/postspawn tournament.

PBA Bowling
programme.desc: Bowlers compete for a $100,000 top prize in the final; Marshall Kent of Clarkston, Mich. won his seventh career PBA Tour title and maiden major championship crown with his 205-201 victory over Anthony Simonsen in last year's edition.

programme.desc: Eagles quarterback Jalen Hurts gives back to local Philadelphia kids through his shoes, while former NBA star Randy Foye helps student athletes navigate the world of NIL and a celebration of the legacy of baseball Hall of Famer Frank Robinson.

programme.desc: The top pro modified drivers compete against each other with three different engine setups in nitrous, blower and turbo, featuring detailed coverage of all the racing action, updates on track conditions, and highlights of memorable moments.

programme.title: Australian Football League
programme.desc: Western (3-3-0) has won seven of the eight previous meetings with the Giants, including a 98-61 victory last season in Round 24, as the Bulldogs kicked five goals to one in the final quarter; GWS (4-2-0) suffered a 52-34 loss to Adelaide on April 19.

programme.desc: Thorough coverage of the latest NHRA events is showcased, including detailed play-by-play, replays of the most exciting and pivotal moments from the race as well as exclusive interviews, special features, insightful commentary and highlights.

programme.desc: Action movie star Keanu Reeves and Cody Jones from Dude Perfect take to the legendary Indianapolis Motor Speedway for a head-to-head race, as all-access footage shows the training and preparation between car and driver leading up to the event.
